title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon - Wikipedia
snippet: Jean-Luc Antoine Pierre Mélenchon (French: [ʒɑ̃lyk melɑ̃ʃɔ̃] ⓘ; born 19 August 1951) is a French politician who has been the de facto leader of the movement La France Insoumise (LFI) since it was established in 2016. He was the deputy in the National Assembly for the 4th constituency of Bouches-du-Rhône from 2017 to 2022 and led the La France Insoumise group in the National Assembly from 2017 to 2021.

title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon Casts a Long Shadow Over the Stagnant French Left
snippet: If Sanders’ strength flows from his status as the consummate outsider—a man preaching the same basic message for decades—Mélenchon’s comes from his capacity for reinvention: for understanding his country’s shifting political sands and seizing the opportunities before him. The first major turning point came in 2005. Breaking with Socialist Party leadership, Mélenchon campaigned for a “no” vote in France’s referendum on a new EU constitution, deriding the failed proposal as a neoliberal Trojan horse.
